text: The big update to Enshrouded hit last week and I have been dying to dig into the changes. Welcome to Enshrouded Unfortunately real life has kept our group from being able to get together on our restarted server and I haven’t wanted to race ahead or finish up server level quests, which has left me in a somewhat limited domain.  I even rolled up an alt to try the magic path, just to get a feel for that.  I had to go rescue the alchemist then, if only so I could make charges for my staff. Some men just want to watch the world burn But mostly I have tried to restrain myself from going to far afield, which has had me exploring the area around our base in more detail and digging into bits and pieces of the latest update, which has changed quite a bit.  This has actually forced me to focus a bit on the early areas that are easy to rush past. Gliding in on the location of our old base in the past run In some ways that has been a boon.  I have, in fact, found things I didn’t run across before in my past hurry to move forward.  The blank areas of the map always call to me.  And the update added some more to that. But mostly I have been delving into the shroud. The shroud awaits I will admit that, on our first run through the game, I treated the shroud more as a hazard to be avoided than a place to explore.  Sure, you have to go there for all sorts of things, and shroud roots most of all, but still I didn’t wander in there any more than I absolutely had to.  That timer looming over you, especially at lower levels… who need that kind of pressure? But a lot of the Thralls of Twilight changes were to night time behavior and the shroud. So I went to the settings for our server and made night time longer than four minutes… though, so far, beyond being able to find fireflies easily, the whole night things hasn’t really endeared itself to me so far… and cranked the shroud timer modifier up to 2x so I could spend some time exploring the shroud without having to obsess quite so much about my time left. We’re only at flame level 2… again, holding off on slaying the matron until we have a group… so the default shroud timer does not encourage lingering in the mist. And it is misty.  Before the update the shroud was often more like some Central Valley Tule fog, which can be pretty light and open at times, then suddenly dense and oppressive when you hit a thick patch. Now the shroud is in more of a pea soup of fog, dense enough in places that you might think it was night out, only to emerge into midday. Down in a dark corner of the shroud… pretty sure it was daylight out when I took this To compensate for that, there do seem to be a lot more bits of light glowing down in the shroud.  It is easier to get around down there at night than it is up in some of the forest or open grassland areas, where a black wolf on dark grass in a pitch black night is hard to fight if your weapon doesn’t cast any light. There are also new resources to find.  The mobs mostly seem the same… though I did run into one of the new mobs at the edge of my exploration radius… though I did not get a screen shot as I was in over my head level-wise, so opted to run away a bit.  Still, there are things to explore and test. I am sure this will be a ride… I did find a fell banshee… it turns out those were not new mobs, just mobs I didn’t know the name of previously.  Among other things, they can drop gems for the new weapon socket system.  I ended up with a couple of gems of burning. Gem of Burning But you need a gem forge to socket them.  I found that as well, though that was a bit of travel during which I was made to regret making the night longer.  See the bit about the black wolf at night, then make it a pack. However, arriving at the gem forge I found out you need archaic essence in order to socket a gem.  I had actually collected some of that… another new resource in the shroud… but had neglected to bring any along.  Something for another trip. More shroud mist… this time at night It does seem like we’ll be spending more time in the shroud for this run.  But so far that changes make it seem more interesting… and the resources are going to require us to go in there. Sunrise through the shroud from a high point just above the mist So we shall see what the shroud holds for us as we press onward.
html:
The big update to Enshrouded hit last week and I have been dying to dig into the changes.

Welcome to Enshrouded

Unfortunately real life has kept our group from being able to get together on our restarted server and I haven’t wanted to race ahead or finish up server level quests, which has left me in a somewhat limited domain.  I even rolled up an alt to try the magic path, just to get a feel for that.  I had to go rescue the alchemist then, if only so I could make charges for my staff.

Some men just want to watch the world burn

But mostly I have tried to restrain myself from going to far afield, which has had me exploring the area around our base in more detail and digging into bits and pieces of the latest update, which has changed quite a bit.  This has actually forced me to focus a bit on the early areas that are easy to rush past.

Gliding in on the location of our old base in the past run

In some ways that has been a boon.  I have, in fact, found things I didn’t run across before in my past hurry to move forward.  The blank areas of the map always call to me.  And the update added some more to that.

But mostly I have been delving into the shroud.

The shroud awaits

I will admit that, on our first run through the game, I treated the shroud more as a hazard to be avoided than a place to explore.  Sure, you have to go there for all sorts of things, and shroud roots most of all, but still I didn’t wander in there any more than I absolutely had to.  That timer looming over you, especially at lower levels… who need that kind of pressure?

But a lot of the Thralls of Twilight changes were to night time behavior and the shroud.

So I went to the settings for our server and made night time longer than four minutes… though, so far, beyond being able to find fireflies easily, the whole night things hasn’t really endeared itself to me so far… and cranked the shroud timer modifier up to 2x so I could spend some time exploring the shroud without having to obsess quite so much about my time left.

We’re only at flame level 2… again, holding off on slaying the matron until we have a group… so the default shroud timer does not encourage lingering in the mist.

And it is misty.  Before the update the shroud was often more like some Central Valley Tule fog, which can be pretty light and open at times, then suddenly dense and oppressive when you hit a thick patch.

Now the shroud is in more of a pea soup of fog, dense enough in places that you might think it was night out, only to emerge into midday.

Down in a dark corner of the shroud… pretty sure it was daylight out when I took this

To compensate for that, there do seem to be a lot more bits of light glowing down in the shroud.  It is easier to get around down there at night than it is up in some of the forest or open grassland areas, where a black wolf on dark grass in a pitch black night is hard to fight if your weapon doesn’t cast any light.

There are also new resources to find.  The mobs mostly seem the same… though I did run into one of the new mobs at the edge of my exploration radius… though I did not get a screen shot as I was in over my head level-wise, so opted to run away a bit.  Still, there are things to explore and test.

I am sure this will be a ride…

I did find a fell banshee… it turns out those were not new mobs, just mobs I didn’t know the name of previously.  Among other things, they can drop gems for the new weapon socket system.  I ended up with a couple of gems of burning.

Gem of Burning

But you need a gem forge to socket them.  I found that as well, though that was a bit of travel during which I was made to regret making the night longer.  See the bit about the black wolf at night, then make it a pack.

However, arriving at the gem forge I found out you need archaic essence in order to socket a gem.  I had actually collected some of that… another new resource in the shroud… but had neglected to bring any along.  Something for another trip.

More shroud mist… this time at night

It does seem like we’ll be spending more time in the shroud for this run.  But so far that changes make it seem more interesting… and the resources are going to require us to go in there.

Sunrise through the shroud from a high point just above the mist

So we shall see what the shroud holds for us as we press onward.
